Day 1 - March 16, 2022:
- Self-driving from San Jose to Portland (duration: 10 hours 14 mins, distance: 1,073 km, cost: 53)
- Arrival in Portland and check-in at The Nines Hotel, a luxury pet-friendly hotel (Price: $216 for two nights)
- Dinner at Tusk, offering Mediterranean-inspired cuisine with outdoor seating (Estimated cost: $50)

Day 2 - March 17, 2022:
- Breakfast at Crema Coffee PDX, a pet-friendly cafe (Estimated cost: $15)
- Self-driving to the Washington Park area to visit the International Rose Test Garden and Japanese Garden (duration: 30 mins, distance: 9.6 km, cost: free)
- Lunch at Le Pigeon, a French bistro with outdoor seating (Estimated cost: $50)
- Afternoon self-driving to the Pearl District for shopping and sightseeing (duration: 15 mins, distance: 3.4 km, cost: free)
- Dinner at Cha Cha Taqueria, a Mexican restaurant with outdoor seating (Estimated cost: $30)

Day 3 - March 18, 2022:
- Breakfast at Pine Street Market, an indoor food hall that allows pets (Estimated cost: $20)
- Self-driving to the Alberta Arts District for sightseeing and shopping (duration: 20 mins, distance: 7.6 km, cost: free)
- Lunch at Bollywood Theater, an Indian food restaurant with outdoor seating (Estimated cost: $40)
- Afternoon self-driving to Powell's City of Books, a famous bookstore that allows pets (duration: 10 mins, distance: 2.6 km, cost: free)
- Dinner at Little Bird Bistro, a French restaurant with outdoor seating (Estimated cost: $50)
- Self-driving from Portland to San Jose (duration: 10 hours 20 mins, distance: 1,074 km, cost: 53)

Total Estimated Cost: $539 + Dining: $255 = $794 (within the budget of $1,000)
